ko: 도랑을 다 파고 나면 꽃 심는 건 쉬울 거예요.

en: They set up a tombstone over the grave overlooking the harbor.
ko: 항구가 내려다보이는 무덤 위에 비석을 세웠어요.

en: Could you tell me the way to the port?
The harbor was crowded with vessels of every description.
There are many ships in the harbor.
How long does it take to get to your office from the port?
Hiroki was at a loss what to do.
Previously, floods were fate for the region.
The damage from the flood was negligible.
The town was desolate after the flood.
The rice crop was poor, owing to the floods.
ko: 홍수 때문에 쌀 수확이 안 좋았어요.

en: The flood parted them.
The flood prevented me from crossing the river.
ko: 홍수 때문에 강을 건널 수가 없었어요.

en: The course of the river has been diverted by the flood.
The threatening floods made it necessary to evacuate the town.
ko: 홍수 위협 때문에 마을 사람들이 대피해야 했어요.

en: The flood deposited a layer of mud.
The flood diverted the course of the river.
Streets and houses were drowned by the flood.
The bridge gave way because of the flood.
The house was undermined by the flood.
Hundreds of fields were submerged in the flood.
ko: 홍수로 수백 개의 논밭이 물에 잠겼어요.

en: Three persons are missing with the flood.
Three people are missing after the flood.
ko: 홍수 이후에 세 명이 실종된 상태예요.

en: The flood caused a lot of damage.
The flood did the village extensive damage.
The flood waters tumbled my house into the river.
ko: 홍수 물에 휩쓸려 우리 집이 강으로 떠내려갔어요.

en: The flood overwhelmed the village.
The flood began to subside.
The flood did great damage to the crops.
Floods, violent wind storms, droughts, killing frosts, and the problems of air pollution have all, on occasion, influenced modern society.
ko: 홍수, 폭풍, 가뭄, 서리, 그리고 대기 오염 문제는 때때로 현대 사회에 영향을 끼쳐요.

en: A samurai in the Edo era carried two swords.
ko: 에도 시대 사무라이는 칼을 두 자루 차고 다녔어요.

en: I met her on campus yesterday.
The gates of the school open at eight.
The schoolyard was very small.
There are some students in the schoolyard.
Our principal made a long speech.
ko: 우리 교장 선생님 훈화 말씀이 정말 길었어요.

en: The headmaster will present the winners their prize.
ko: 교장 선생님이 우승자들에게 상을 주실 거예요.

en: Our principal wanted to admit Bob to our school.
ko: 교장 선생님이 밥을 우리 학교에 입학시키고 싶어 하셨어요.

en: Where did you come across the principal?
The meeting was held at the principal's office.
The principal called him to account for being absent without an excuse.
ko: 교장 선생님이 무단결석한 이유를 따지려고 그를 불렀어요.

en: The principal shook hands with each of the graduating pupils.
ko: 교장 선생님이 졸업하는 학생들 한 명 한 명이랑 악수했어.

en: The principal shook hands with each of the graduates.
ko: 교장 선생님이 졸업생들 한 명 한 명이랑 악수했어.

en: The principal presented each of the graduates with diploma.
ko: 교장 선생님이 졸업생들 한 명 한 명한테 졸업장을 줬어.

en: The principal assured me of her honesty.
ko: 교장 선생님은 자기가 정직하다고 나한테 확신을 줬어.

en: Mr Bush, principal of our school, graduated from Yale.
ko: 우리 학교 교장 선생님인 부시 씨는 예일대를 졸업했어.

en: The principal came in after the teacher.
ko: 선생님이 들어오고 나서 교장 선생님이 들어오셨어.

en: You should observe the school rules.
The school rules require students to wear school uniforms.
ko: 교칙에 따르면 학생들은 교복을 입어야 해.

en: You must not run in the school buildings.
ko: 학교 건물 안에서 뛰면 안 돼.

en: The schoolhouse was burnt to ashes.
ko: 학교 건물이 다 타서 잿더미가 됐어.

en: The news that the school had been burned down soon spread though the town.
ko: 학교가 다 탔다는 소문이 마을에 금방 퍼졌어.

en: I have menopausal troubles.
To make matters worse, it began to rain heavily.
Attack is the best form of defense.
He has too many interests, to put it mildly.
ko: 좋게 말해서 관심사가 너무 많은 거지.

en: He was rather careless to say the least.
ko: 좋게 말해도 그 사람은 좀 부주의했어.

en: It is not good, to say the least.
It was a good dinner, to say the least.
ko: 말할 것도 없이 정말 괜찮은 저녁 식사였어.

en: To say the least, he seems to be a bad person.
ko: 아무리 좋게 봐줘도 그 사람은 나쁜 사람인 것 같아.

en: He is not a good student, to say the least.
He is not a cheerful guy, to say the least.
ko: 좋게 말해도 그 사람이 밝은 성격은 아니야.

en: Antibodies give a new lease of life.
ko: 항체 덕분에 새로운 삶을 찾은 거나 마찬가지야.

en: Keep taking this antibiotic until it is gone.
ko: 이 항생제 다 먹을 때까지 계속 복용해야 돼.

en: If it had not been for antibiotics, medicine would not have made such remarkable progress.
ko: 항생제가 없었으면 의학이 이렇게까지 발전하지 못했을 거야.

en: We protested, but it was in vain.
The protesters barricaded the entrance.
Before I could protest, I was handcuffed and was on my way to prison.
ko: 항의하기도 전에 수갑 차고 감옥으로 끌려갔어.

en: Take your time. I know you need a couple of days to reflect on it.
ko: 천천히 해. 생각할 시간이 며칠 필요하다는 거 알아.

en: You don't have to dress in a mad rush; we've got time.
ko: 서둘러서 옷 입을 필요 없어, 시간 넉넉해.

en: Let's not make any hasty decisions. Let's sleep on it.
ko: 성급하게 결정하지 말고 하룻밤 더 생각해보자.

en: From hand to mouth will never make a worthy man.
ko: 하루 벌어 하루 먹고 살기만 해서는 훌륭한 사람이 될 수 없어.

en: A bad carpenter quarrels with his tools.
Anyone can make a mistake.
Even Kōbō Daishi's calligraphy is sometimes at fault.
Hiromi goes to school five days a week.
I never went to Hiroshima on my trip.
ko: 여행 중에 히로시마에는 한 번도 안 갔어.

en: I am from Hiroshima, but now I live in Tokyo.
On the open ice a bear may lie on its stomach.
ko: 탁 트인 얼음 위에서 곰이 배를 깔고 누워 있을 수도 있어.

en: A vast forest covers the mountains.
A vast desert lay before us.
ko: 우리 앞에 끝없는 사막이 펼쳐져 있었어.

en: Doctor Hirose is engaged in AIDS research.
ko: 히로세 박사님은 에이즈 연구를 하고 계셔.

en: Mr Hirose teaches the students English grammar.
ko: 히로세 선생님은 학생들한테 영어 문법을 가르쳐.

en: We would appreciate your contacting Mr Hirose.
We would appreciate it if you would contact Mr. Hirose.
ko: 히로세 씨한테 연락해 주면 정말 감사할 것 같아.

en: The square buzzed with excitement.
The square was illuminated by bright lights.
ko: 광장이 환한 조명으로 밝게 빛나고 있었어.

en: There were several hundred people in the plaza.
Look at that pole in the square.
ko: 광장에 있는 저 기둥 좀 봐.

en: How about we play baseball in the open space?
ko: 우리 저 공터에서 야구 하는 거 어때?

en: Hiroko has charming features.
Hiroko sat there all alone.
ko: 히로코는 거기 혼자 덩그러니 앉아 있었어.

en: Advertising makes up about 7% of this company's expenses.
ko: 광고비가 이 회사 지출의 한 7% 정도 차지해.

en: The ad agency has a lot riding on this account.
ko: 그 광고 대행사는 이번 건에 사활을 걸었어.

en: The purpose of advertising is to familiarize consumers with the name of a product.
ko: 광고의 목적은 소비자들한테 제품 이름을 익숙하게 만드는 거야.

en: I was lured to the store by the advertisement.
ko: 광고 보고 혹해서 그 가게에 갔어.

en: Don't get taken in by their advertising; I don't see how they can sell something like that for that price.
ko: 걔네 광고에 속지 마. 그 가격에 그런 걸 어떻게 파는지 난 이해가 안 가.

en: When it comes to advertising, Coke is ahead of the game.
ko: 광고에 있어서는 코카콜라가 한 수 위야.

en: As he entered the hall, two men approached him.
ko: 그가 홀에 들어서자마자 남자 두 명이 다가왔어.

en: There was heavy snow over a large area.
ko: 넓은 지역에 걸쳐 눈이 엄청 많이 왔어.

en: Man is also an animal in a broad sense.
ko: 넓은 의미에서 보면 인간도 동물의 일종이야.

en: God, this place is huge!
Large, isn't it?
This place is large, isn't it?
Talk about spacious!
Who is there but hopes for happiness?
ko: 행복을 바라지 않는 사람이 어디 있겠어?

en: You can't judge happiness in terms of money.
Everybody has the right to seek happiness.
It is only normal to want to be happy.
Happiness consists of working toward one's goals.
ko: 행복은 자기 목표를 향해 나아가는 데 있어.

en: Everybody knows that happiness is in contentment.
ko: 행복은 만족하는 마음에 있다는 건 누구나 다 알지.

en: You cannot buy happiness.
Happiness can't be bought.
ko: 행복은 돈으로 살 수 있는 게 아니야.

en: You can't buy happiness.
You have to snatch at happiness when you can.
ko: 행복은 기회가 왔을 때 꽉 잡아야 해.

en: Happiness does not consist simply in wealth.
ko: 행복이 단순히 부유함에 있는 건 아니야.

en: Happiness consists of good health.
It goes without saying that you can't buy happiness.
ko: 행복을 돈으로 살 수 없다는 건 말할 필요도 없지.

en: It goes without saying that money can't buy you happiness.
ko: 돈이 행복을 가져다주지 않는다는 건 당연한 소리야.

en: Happiness depends, not so much on circumstances, as on one's way of looking at one's life.
ko: 행복은 환경보다는 삶을 바라보는 태도에 달려 있어.

en: I'm on top of the world.
The idea of happiness is extremely abstract.
I am fortunate enough to have access to an excellent library.
ko: 좋은 도서관을 이용할 수 있어서 정말 다행이야.

en: Health is indispensable to a happy life.
If you wish to be happy, learn to be content with your condition in life.
ko: 행복해지고 싶으면 지금 네 처지에 만족하는 법을 배워봐.

en: Some are happy; others unhappy.
ko: 행복한 사람도 있고, 불행한 사람도 있는 법이야.

en: Happy is the man who knows his limits.
ko: 자신의 한계를 아는 사람이 행복한 사람이야.

en: It was wrong to try to judge happiness in terms of worldly success.
ko: 세상적인 성공으로 행복을 판단하려고 한 건 잘못이었어.

en: Happiness lies in contentment.
Happiness does not consist of how much you possess.
ko: 행복은 얼마나 가졌느냐에 달린 게 아니야.

en: Happiness is sometimes identified with money.
ko: 가끔 사람들은 행복이랑 돈을 똑같이 생각하기도 해.

en: Riches amount to little without happiness.
ko: 행복하지 않으면 부자가 다 무슨 소용이야.

en: Being happy always reminded her of her loss.
ko: 행복해질 때마다 그녀는 잃어버린 것들이 생각났어.

en: Whether happiness is the supreme value or not, it is earnestly desired by man.
ko: 행복이 최고의 가치든 아니든, 사람들은 그걸 간절히 원해.

en: Isn't Yukimasa so cute?
Few people can speak English better than Sachiko.
ko: 사치코보다 영어를 더 잘하는 사람은 거의 없어.

en: I wish you the best of luck.
Good luck!
Hanako walked through the hallway making a clicking sound.
ko: 하나코가 또각또각 소리를 내며 복도를 걸어갔어.

en: What with good fortune, and his own effort, he won the first prize in the contest.
ko: 운도 좋았고 본인도 노력해서 대회에서 1등을 했어.

en: Through his own efforts and a bit of luck, he won first prize in the contest.
ko: 본인 노력에 운까지 좀 따라줘서 대회 우승을 차지했어.

en: Luck comes to those who look for it.
Lady Luck favors the adventuresome.
Luckily she did not die.
Fortunately, she didn't die.
Luckily, he won the championship.
Fortunately, he was free of debt.
Luckily, he won the game.
Happily he did not die.
Fortunately he didn't die in the accident.
Fortunately, the weather was good.
Luckily, I won first prize.
He was so fortunate as to escape death.
ko: 걔는 운 좋게 죽을 고비를 넘겼어.

en: Luckily, the weather turned out fine.
Luckily, I was able to get the tickets yesterday.
Fortunately they had no storms on the way.
Fortune smiled on him.
Fortunately, I made it to the class.
Happiness consists of contentment.
Happiness does not consist only in having many things.
ko: 행복은 단순히 많이 가진다고 오는 게 아니야.

en: Happiness isn't merely having many possessions.
ko: 행복은 그냥 소유물이 많다고 생기는 게 아니야.

en: Happiness depends not so much on circumstances as on one's way of looking at one's lot.
ko: 행복은 환경보다는 자기 처지를 어떻게 보느냐에 달려 있어.

en: Happily, she was not involved in the troubles.
ko: 다행히 걔는 그 일에 안 얽혔어.

en: Nothing in the world gives people so much real pleasure as having a happy family.
ko: 행복한 가정을 꾸리는 것만큼 큰 기쁨은 세상에 없어.

en: Happy is the man who is contented.
Aren't you the lucky one?
Best wishes for a happy and prosperous New Year.
ko: 새해 복 많이 받고 대박 나길 바라.

en: She said that she was happy.
Fortunately, no one was hurt.
Fortunately I was able to finish my work without any serious errors.
ko: 다행히 큰 실수 없이 일 끝냈어.

en: I am happy to notify you that I have fully recovered.
ko: 다 나았다고 말할 수 있어서 기뻐.

en: She was not seriously injured.
Fortunately he is in a good position and has broad shoulders.
ko: 다행히 걔는 처지도 괜찮고 어깨도 넓어.

en: Fortunately, they escaped the danger.
Luckily nobody got wet.
Fortunately none of the passengers were injured.
ko: 다행히 승객 중에 다친 사람은 없었어.

en: Happily the crops were not harmed by the typhoon.
ko: 다행히 태풍 때문에 농작물이 피해를 입지는 않았어.

en: He escaped injury, happily.
Happily, the workaholic did not die.
Luckily, Dick's father was not killed in the war.
ko: 다행히 딕의 아버지는 전쟁에서 돌아가시지 않았어.

en: Blessed are the poor in spirit.
Luckily, I got hold of a branch and was saved from falling.
Fortunately, I was on time.
Fortunately, my son quickly adjusted to life in his new school.
ko: 다행히 우리 아들이 새 학교에 금방 적응했어.

en: Fair words butter no parsnips.
Skillful management made a success of the business.
ko: 수완 좋은 경영 덕분에 사업이 성공했어.

en: Skillful diplomacy helps to avert war.
ko: 능숙한 외교가 전쟁을 막는 데 도움이 돼.

en: Many factory workers consider themselves just an average Joe.
ko: 많은 공장 노동자들이 스스로를 그냥 평범한 사람이라고 생각해.

en: The families of the factory workers need schools, hospitals, and stores, so more people come to live in the area to provide these services, and thus a city grows.
ko: 공장 노동자 가족들에게 학교, 병원, 가게가 필요하니까 이런 서비스를 제공하려고 더 많은 사람이 모여들고, 그렇게 도시가 커지는 거야.

en: Factory waste has polluted the sea.
That will be better than the factory.
The factory has been transferred to Hokkaido.
Factories have been urged to switch from coal to a cleaner fuel.
ko: 공장들은 석탄 대신 더 깨끗한 연료로 바꾸라는 권고를 받았어.
